item.title: Grow A Garden: All Mutations (& How to Get Them)
item.description:
In Roblox ’s Grow A Garden , you get to take care of your own digital garden, where fruits can grow massive and show off unique patterns and designs. While checking out your garden (or visiting your neighbor's), you might have spotted fruits that look a bit different. Some are dripping water, some are frozen solid, and some have shiny stars sparkling around them.

These are called mutations, and every Grow A Garden player should know about them. They’re a big part of what can turn you into a millionaire (or even a billionaire) in this cute botanical sim. So, if you're wondering what each mutation does and how to get them on your crops, this guide has got you covered.

Updated by Somiya Adrees on June 21, 2025: I n this article, you’ll find the value of all mutations added up to the 1.11.0 update. This includes the event mutations, as players can still trigger some of them using tools and pets by trading with others. The Best Mutations list and the Stacked Mutations section have also been refreshed to reflect the current top picks in the game, helping you aim for the most profitable options.

How to Get Mutations in Grow a Garden

Mutations are basically cool changes that happen to your plants. Some depend on weather events, while others can be activated by using tools, setups, or special variant seeds. They not only make your garden look way more colorful and shiny, but also help you get rich real quick.

Getting mutations on your fruits and veggies can seriously boost their selling price. Below is a list of all the mutations in the game, how much each one sells for, and easy ways to grow them faster.

All Mutations

Sell Value

How to Get Them

Big

1x Value (but it can increase with the fruit’s weight)

Place sprinklers near your fruits; each one is available at the Gear Shop. The mutation can kick in at any time , but only a small patch of nearby fruits will grow bigger. It’s a great way to earn money if the fruit already has other mutations on it or if you’re testing the sprinkler glitch to make it massive.

Ripe

1x Value

Each in-game day, there's a chance a Sugar Apple will mutate on its own and change in appearance. This variant only applies to Sugar Apples and doesn’t affect their selling value.

Wet

2x Value

Wait for rainy weather (it usually shows up every 10–15 minutes), and let your crops soak. Rain can bless all your harvests, but there's only about a 50% chance they'll get the Wet mutation.

Chilled

2x Value

This one sparks in frost weather , which can randomly pop up on the server. Just keep an eye on your crops while the weather is active; there’s a good chance they’ll pick it up on their own. Players can also use a Polar Bear to force the Chilled Mutation on their plants.

Chocolate

2x Value

Set a Chocolate Sprinkler next to the seeds or plants, and start collecting chocolate fruits from them as they ripen. Since it only lasts a minute, using it with regular sprinklers helps the seeds and fruits grow faster. You can also wait for Chocolate Rain to get this variant.

Moonlit

2x Value

This mutation can occur automatically on some of your plants during a Night Event . Placing a Night Staff in your garden can help trigger it faster.

Windstruck

2x Value

During Windy weather , strong gusts may trigger the Windstruck mutation on your plants.

Pollinated

3x Value

Let the Bee Swarm event start or have special bees bite crops on your farm, especially Honey Bees, Wasps, Tarantula Hawks, Bees, Petal Bees, and Queen Bees.

Burnt

4x Value

Use a Cooked Owl in your garden to turn your crops into the Burnt variant every 15.01 minutes.

Bloodlit

4x Value

When the Blood Moon event begins (which has a 33% chance of happening during the Lunar Glow Night Event), some of your plants might randomly gain the Bloodlit mutation. Using a Night Staff nearby can boost the chances.

Verdant

4x Value

Hatch the Scarlet Macaw from the Paradise Egg and set it in your plot. Every 11.57 minutes, there is a 15.78% chance it will activate this mutation.

HoneyGlazed

5x Value

Set a Honey Sprinkler on your plot; it’ll work for a minute and turn your crops HoneyGlazed. Or drop a Bear Bee , which does the same every 25 minutes.

Heavenly

5x Value

Hop into the server during the Floating Jandel event (usually during Live Update launches), where a monkey rests mid-air and turns your crops Heavenly.

Plasma

5x Value

When the Lazer event happens, a giant monkey might target your plot with red laser beams, giving your crops the Plasma mutation.

Twisted

5x Value

If a Tornado Event starts while you're on the server, a tornado might sweep through your garden and apply this variant to a few crops.

Frozen

10x Value

Once your fruits and veggies get the Wet mutation, hold off on picking them. When frost weather hits or a Polar Bear is active, those crops might turn into Frozen ones.

Paradisal

18x Value

If your crop gets both Verdant and Sundried mutations, it will shift into the Paradisal variant. This is not the best variant, since it lowers the value of Sundried, which gives an 85x multiplier. It’s better to stick with Sundried fruits.

Golden

20x Value

This one is a luck-based mutation . Normally, you might see it appear on just one out of 100 plants, but you can increase your chances a bit by setting up tools like the Advanced Sprinkler, Godly Sprinkler, or Master Sprinkler. Planting a Super Seed or using a Dragonfly can also guarantee a gold variant plant.

Cooked

25x Value

You can only get this variant from a Cooked Owl . Leave it in your garden, and it has a 15.28% chance to randomly cook fruits. Its ability resets every 15.01 minutes, which you can reduce by aging it.

Zombified

25x Value

Just drop a Chicken Zombie on your farmland, and it’ll grant some of your fruits this greenish mutation.

Molten

25x Value

Once the devs kick off the Volcano Event and giant molten chunks float into your garden, certain plants will pick up this mutation.

Rainbow

50x Value

This one can show up on its own, but it’s pretty rare. To get it faster, you can buy Super Seeds from the Premium Shop, use gear like the Godly or Master Sprinklers, or leave a Butterfly in your garden.

Sundried

85x Value

Players can grab this variant when Heatwave Weather hits the server and sunbeams strike your crops. You can boost the likelihood by using a Tanning Mirror (available at the Gear Shop) near your desired crops to attract sunbeams.

Shocked

100x Value

You can get this mutation when lightning hits your crops during thunderstorm weather . Since the odds are pretty low, it’s a good idea to place a Lightning Rod in your garden. Plants near it will have a higher chance of receiving the Shocked Mutation.

Alienlike

100x Value

This is one of the admin-exclusive mutations that can show up on your fruits during the Alien Invasion Event when the UFO flying over the server affects the plants.

Celestial

120x Value

This variant can appear when a meteor hits your crops during Meteor Shower weather . To raise your chances, set a Star Caller in your plot; it helps attract falling stars.

Galactic

120x Value

During the Space Travel Event (triggered by an admin), the whole server will launch into space, and a few crops will gain this variant.

Disco

125x Value

Wait for an admin to start the Disco Event. During it, your avatar will dance, and some fruits in your garden will develop this bold, colorful mutation. You can also leave a Disco Bee to get this variant.

Voidtouched

135x Value

When the Black Hole Event triggers (which only devs can activate), some of your fruits will become Voidtouched.

Dawnbound

150x Value

Only Sunflowers can take on this mutation. Once Jandel kicks off the Sungod Event , gather four players, each holding a Sunflower, and show them to the Golden Monkey to trigger the mutation.

Grow a Garden's Stacked Mutations, Explained

Perhaps one of the coolest parts of Grow a Garden is how mutations can stack. That means a single fruit or veggie can have more than one mutation at once. When that happens, its price can shoot up to billions and even trillions.

To stack mutations in Grow a Garden, just favorite any plants that already have a mutation (so nobody can steal them), then let them soak up more mutations during weather events or by using sprinklers and other items. Here’s how wild the prices can get with stacked mutations:

Best Stacked Mutations

Sell Value

Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen + Windstruck + Disco + Choc + Celestial + Bloodlit + Moonlit + Zombified + Plasma + Pollinated + HoneyGlazed + Voidtouched + Heavenly + Dawnbound + Cooked + Molten

36,100x Value

Voidtouched + Heavenly + Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen +Moonlit + Disco + Celestial + Choc + Bloodlit + Pollinated + HoneyGlazed + Zombified + Plasma

26,450x Value

Disco + Celestial + Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen + Moonlit + Choc

17,700x Value

Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen + Moonlit + Choc

5,550x Value

Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen + Choc or Moonlit

5,500x Value

Best Mutations in Grow a Garden

While Dawnbound and Voidtouched are the best mutations in Grow a Garden right now, they’re also pretty rare, since they rely on admins starting the events. Still, here are some other top-tier variants you can go for daily if you're looking to farm a bunch of Sheckles:

  • Disco is undoubtedly the best variant in GaG that’s also easy to get. Just use Disco Bees to collect multiple of these every in-game day.
  • Celestial is another great pick for F2P players. You can collect more of these fruits by waiting for the right weather during nighttime or placing Star Callers regularly.
  • Shocked fruits are really valuable. Since they’re not tied to any event, they show up more frequently. All you need is some patience and a proper setup with a Lightning Rod to harvest a bunch daily.

item.title: Flex UGC Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Flex UGC is a Roblox experience for buying UGC. You won't find game content here, as it's a marketplace where you can sell, trade, and buy items. Creators usually make packs of items and sell them. If you buy certain items, you can redeem codes and get more freebies. You can find Flex UGC codes in the list below.

Updated June 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Flex UGC has a fresh batch of codes that unlock limited-time avatar items like weapons, hats, and accessories. Two new codes are currently active, each providing exclusive cosmetics such as the White and Black Valk and the Formidulosus Sword. Make sure to redeem them while they’re still available.

How to Redeem Codes in Flex UGC

In many Roblox games, it is easy to redeem codes. The same applies to Flex UGC . When you enter the experience, the option to redeem codes is literally the first thing you will see. Nevertheless, if you need a hint, you can use our guide below, in which we explain how to redeem codes in Flex UGC .

  • Open Roblox and launch Flex UGC .
  • After loading, you will immediately see a window. Click the Redeem a Code button.
  • In the field, paste the code from the list of working codes and click Redeem.

Remember that codes in Flex UGC can quickly expire, and it depends on many factors. Item creators may restrict access for some reason or simply run out of copies of the items. Therefore, redeem codes as soon as possible while you can.

How to get More Flex UGC Codes

There are many Roblox codes for Flex UGC and they are easy to find. They're posted on the board to the right of the spawn point, so you can look for them yourself. You can also use this guide too. We update it regularly so that you get the latest codes.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Imaginarium Theater for August 2025
item.description:
Recent datamining has revealed that Genshin Impact is adding a rather unorthodox Imaginarium Theater in August 2025, predominantly focused on the Swirl and Superconduct Elemental Reactions. It has been nearly a year since the Imaginarium Theater was introduced to Genshin Impact , and it's safe to say that it has firmly entrenched itself as part of the endgame. Whereas the Spiral Abyss values vertical investment, as well as having the currently featured 5-Stars, the Imaginarium Theater promotes having a well-built roster of specific elements.

With the introduction of Rimegrass in Version 5.6, HoYoverse has shown a willingness to experiment with gameplay using the Imaginarium Theater as a platform. It remains to be seen if Rimegrass will ever be implemented as a proper Elemental Reaction in Genshin Impact , but player reception has certainly been positive.

According to Seele Leaks, the Imaginarium Theater for August 2025 will have Cryo, Electro, and Anemo as the featured elements. Excluding Special Guests, this effectively limits Elemental Reactions to Swirl and Superconduct. The Opening Characters for Season 14 will include: Yae Miko, Kuki Shinobu, Ganyu, Layla, Yumemizuki Mizuki, and Sucrose. In terms of Special Guests, players will potentially have Tighnari, Kokomi, Xingqiu, and Gaming at their disposal. Tighnari and Yae Miko should be able to form a formidable Aggravate team in Genshin Impact .

Genshin Impact: Imaginarium Theater for August 2025 (Version 5.8)

Opening Characters

  • Yae Miko – 5-Star Electro Catalyst
  • Kuki Shinobu – 4-Star Electro Sword
  • Ganyu – 5-Star Cryo Bow
  • Layla – 4-Star Cryo Sword
  • Yumemizuki Mizuki – 5-Star Anemo Catalyst
  • Sucrose – 4-Star Anemo Catalyst

Special Guests

  • Tighnari – 5-Star Dendro Bow
  • Kokomi – 5-Star Hydro Catalyst
  • Xingqiu – 4-Star Hydro Sword
  • Gaming – 4-Star Pyro Claymore

Boss Chambers

  • Jadeplume Terrorshroom
  • Perpetual Mechanical Array
  • Maguu Kenki
  • Solitary Suanni

While Superconduct has featured in the Imaginarium Theater two times prior to August 2025, it will be front-and-center in this upcoming season. Physical hypercarries such as Freminet and Eula in Genshin Impact will thrive, but other Cryo characters will need to rely on Special Guests like Xingqiu or Gaming. Thankfully, the Solitary Suanni can be countered with Cryo DMG alone, while the Maguu Kenki doesn't have any specific resistances to counter – albeit it does favor melee characters.

The Imaginarium Theater in Genshin Impact will no doubt continue to evolve in Nod-Krai, as the upcoming region is expected to introduce a whole new set of Elemental Reactions. Hopefully, the developers will use Opening Characters to make these Lunar reactions available to all players. However, given that Ineffa is treated as a Special Guest in Season 15, the chances of it happening are slim. Version 5.8 will feature two Imaginarium Theater seasons, with Version 6.0 launching on September 10, 2025. As for the Event Banners in Version 5.8, Ineffa, Citlali, and Chasca will all be eligible for Season 14 – assuming players manage to obtain them.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games For Feeling Like A Kid Again, Ranked
item.description:
Gaming will never be better than when you were a kid. OK, that might not be true for every single person out there, but games played during somebody's formative years stick in the mind for seemingly ever. As the decades pass and new adventures become harder to discover, you might find yourself longing for that bygone feeling of wonder and excitement that used to come so easily. At least, I'm always searching for a game that can take me back to the PS1 era.

Open-world games are arguably overexposed by this point, but the freedom and wanderlust they provide can be intoxicating. When done right, they are completely immersive, encouraging players to leave themselves behind and become someone new in a fresh world. Let's go through some of the best games that make you feel like a kid again .

Modern-ish games only.

8 Mario Kart World

Mario Kart Will Always Be Mario Kart

7 Images
7 Images
Mario Kart World
16
8.4 /10
Released
June 5, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Nintendo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch 2
Powered by

Recency bias aside, Mario Kart World is just delightful. Did the franchise need to go open-world? Of course not! The formula has worked splendidly for more than two decades, and nobody was craving an overworld map that connects all the tracks. Yet, Mario Kart World added this feature seamlessly, all the while still retaining everything positive associated with the kart racer IP. This could be the best game in the series, a statement that I am almost hesitant to make.

While the gameplay has evolved a lot over the last twenty years, Mario Kart has this way of always feeling consistent with its history. Sure, it is bigger and prettier than ever, but Mario Kart World is ultimately just more Mario Kart .

7 Tchia

A Sympathetic Protagonist In A Culturally Rich World

Tchia
9.0 /10
Released
March 21, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Awaceb
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

A child protagonist is not enough for a game to qualify for this discussion, but Tchia does an admirable job of presenting its world from the perspective of its young lead. While fictional, the project brings to life an archipelago that is based on New Caledonia, a setting that not only feels fresh but is also simply gorgeous.

The world has a well-defined and fascinating culture, all of which is viewed through the lens of a capable girl who just wants to save her father. Tchia also picks up an ability to take over the bodies of different animals and objects, a phenomenon that greatly opens up the gameplay and encourages creativity and experimentation. While not perfect, Tchia is unlike anything else out there.

6 No Man's Sky

5 Images
5 Images
No Man's Sky
7 /10
50
9.1 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Hello Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC, Nintendo Switch 2
Powered by

In the mid-90s, the thought of an open-world game that covers thousands of planets would have been treated as little more than a pipe dream. In 2016, No Man's Sky reached for the stars and, admittedly, fell short, coming out to a very mixed response. Now, roughly a decade later, Hello Games' title is one of the best on the market, particularly if you are craving an exploration-first open-world that incorporates elements of survival.

Although its minute-to-minute gameplay might not conjure up child-like awe, No Man's Sky 's scope and sense of endlessness certainly do. Similar to Minecraft , No Man's Sky taps into that natural desire to create your own stories, free of the confines of linear adventures. It is a game that I enjoy feeling lost in.

5 Cat Quest Series

A Fur-tastic Open-World Game

  • Cat Quest
    5.7 /10
    Released
    August 8, 2017

    WHERE TO PLAY

    SUBSCRIPTION
    DIGITAL

    Developer(s)
    The Gentlebros
    Platform(s)
    Android, iOS, PC, PS4, Switch
    Powered by
  • Cat Quest II
    8.0 /10
    Released
    September 24, 2019

    WHERE TO PLAY

    SUBSCRIPTION
    DIGITAL

    Developer(s)
    The Gentlebros
    Platform(s)
    PC, iOS, PS4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch
    Powered by
  • Cat Quest III
    9.0 /10
    Released
    August 8, 2024

    WHERE TO PLAY

    DIGITAL

    Developer(s)
    The Gentlebros
    Platform(s)
    Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
    Powered by

Cat Quest oozes charm. Seriously, it is relentless. All three games have simple but enjoyable real-time combat, simple but effective customization options, and simple but cute stories. The sequels even have co-op, allowing two players to enjoy these silly adventures together. Set in vibrant worlds and dripping in whimsy, Cat Quest has the same spirit as a picture book or a Saturday Morning Cartoon, albeit done in a way that does not come at the expense of the RPG elements.

Also, just to be clear, this series is not stripped-down and designed for kids. Children will probably have a blast playing through them (and laughing along with the cat puns), but Cat Quest is very much an all-ages trilogy. Some of the bosses are even quite difficult.

4 Digimon World: Next Order (Or Other Spiritual Successors)

Remembering The Good Old Days

Digimon World: Next Order
6.0 /10
Released
January 27, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
B.B. Studio
Platform(s)
PC, PS Vita, PS4, Switch
Powered by

Admittedly, this one might be mainly for me. As somebody who grew up with Digimon World on the PlayStation 1, Digimon World: Next Order scratched an itch that had been left unattended for decades. A monster-raising RPG with slow pacing and a few frustrating elements, B.B. Studio's game is far from perfect, although it is still decent enough to warrant a playthrough even without an element of nostalgia.

Next Order is endearingly weird and janky, in a way that only games from the '90s tend to be. After picking a starter, players raise their Digimon, slowly working their way through a story while unlocking new evolutions, a process that can often lead to dead ends or restarts. Although not particularly big or stunning, the open-world is visually pleasant and offers at least some sense of discovery.

Criticisms aside, the new Pokemon games are good options for die-hard fans who remember the days of Red and Blue. Heck, even stuff like Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot or One Piece Odyssey could scratch the same itch, at least for anime fans.

3 Sea of Thieves

A Merry Time With Friends

Sea of Thieves
8.8 /10
Released
March 20, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rare
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

At times, nothing hits the spot like a bit of messing about. Sea of Thieves is like a whole game dedicated to just that. Form a crew, jump on a ship, and head out onto the open waters, singing songs, catching fish, and fighting skeletons along the way. Maybe take on another pirate ship, or face off against a kraken! Ultimately, the goal is just to spend an afternoon with a few friends and have fun. Gaming can be simple.

That's not to say there is a complete lack of depth, as the game has grown quite nicely over the last few years; however, Sea of Thieves has never lost sight of what it is trying to be. Rare has a long history of creating timeless romps, and this open-world game serves as a culmination of decades of triumphs.

2 Marvel's Spider-Man Series

Fulfilling A Childhood Dream To Become Spider-Man

  • Marvel's Spider-Man
    9.0 /10
    Released
    September 7, 2018

    WHERE TO PLAY

    PHYSICAL

    Developer(s)
    Insomniac Games
    Platform(s)
    PS4, PS5, PC
    Powered by
  • Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales
    9 /10
    17
    8.4 /10
    Released
    November 12, 2020

    WHERE TO PLAY

    SUBSCRIPTION
    DIGITAL
    PHYSICAL

    Developer(s)
    Insomniac Games
    Platform(s)
    PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
    Powered by
  • 8 Images
    8 Images
    Marvel's Spider-Man 2
    9 /10
    48
    8.9 /10
    Released
    October 20, 2023

    WHERE TO PLAY

    DIGITAL
    PHYSICAL

    Developer(s)
    Insomniac Games
    Platform(s)
    PlayStation 5, PC
    Powered by

While not the most consistent theme ever, superhero games are fairly easy to come by nowadays, and most modern releases are enjoyable enough. The Arham trilogy is the definitive "you are Batman" experience, but those games are very much designed for an older audience and might spark a different feeling rather than child-like excitement. Conversely, Marvel's Spider-Man delivers something similar while being a touch more whimsical.

The mere act of swinging across New York is electric and satisfying, especially for players who have been craving this type of evolution and freedom since the days of Spider-Man 2 or even Ultimate Spider-Man . Insomniac's trilogy goes to some fairly real places, story-wise, but the gameplay is 100% grounded in comic book extravaganza, in the best possible way.

1 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

The Majesty Of Hyrule

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
46
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Nintendo EPD
Platform(s)
Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2
Powered by

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is probably the most recommended open-world game of all time, to the point that I was almost tempted to leave it out of this discussion. However, Nintendo created something special here, and they did it by essentially stripping the sandbox concept to its basics.

After being dropped into a vast and stunning version of Hyrule, players are effectively left to their own devices. Want to face the final boss? Sure, go ahead. Want to gradually take on the four Divine Beasts? That makes sense, but it is not required. Want to trek across the map and climb that mountain in the distance that barely seems real? Do it.

In an era when some open-world games started to feel like checklist simulators, BOTW was addictively liberating. Despite the genre being incredibly oversaturated nowadays, the 2017 game still feels fresh, and it rewards players who embrace their desire to explore the unknown.

item.title: Invincible: Guarding The Globe Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Invincible: Guarding The Globe Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Invincible: Guarding The Globe
  • How to Get More Invincible: Guarding The Globe Codes

Invincible: Guarding The Globe is an idle squad RPG from Ubisoft with a superhero concept and an emphasis on epic battles with powerful enemies. Here you will need to summon different superheroes to create a team and strategically destroy enemies that threaten humanity.

To get a good accelerator for your progress, you can redeem Invincible: Guarding The Globe , each of which contains worthwhile rewards. Don't miss the opportunity to get Hero Dossiers, GDA Gems, Molecular Enhancements, and other useful rewards, and hurry up because the codes have a specific expiration date.

Updated June 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: A fresh update has dropped with two new codes that let you grab extra in-game goodies right now. Alongside the existing ones, these additions give you even more chances to boost your progress. If you've already claimed the old rewards, these new ones are worth checking out too. We'll keep an eye on more releases, so be sure to return here soon for the latest extras.

All Invincible: Guarding The Globe Codes

Working Invincible: Guarding The Globe Codes

  • UNOPAN - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards. (NEW)
  • BATTLE - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards. (NEW)
  • BBEAST - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • INVPOD - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • OMNIKD - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.

Expired Invincible: Guarding The Globe Codes

  • NOTES4 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • WYATT3 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • NOLIEN - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • AALIEN - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • OMNIIG - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • ADELYT - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • SHVDYT - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • FRANCS - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • CHARTS - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • FINAL3 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • BILLS3 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • ITSTJ3 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • RYANS3 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • IGTG24 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • S3HERO - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • OMNI24 - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.
  • CLOVER - Redeem this code to get in-game rewards.

How to Redeem Codes for Invincible: Guarding The Globe

Redeeming Invincible: Guarding The Globe codes is quite a complicated process, especially if you have no experience with such things before in other mobile games. Here you won't be able to do it directly in the game, instead, you will need to redeem the codes on the official website, having previously generated a Verification Code. To save you a lot of time, here's how to do it:

  • Launch Invincible: Guarding The Globe .
  • Pay attention to the upper left corner of the screen. There will be an indicator of your level. Click on it.
  • This will open the Player Profile menu. Here, at the bottom of the menu, you will find the Verification Code option. Click the blue Generate button to generate the code.
  • After that, click on the Use Code button to go to the official code redemption site.
  • Here you will see two input fields. In the first one, you need to enter one of the working codes from the list above, and in the second one, you need to enter the Verification Code you generated earlier.

After filling in the fields, click on the blue Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a notification at the bottom of the screen that the rewards have been successfully redeemed and credited to your account.

How to Get More Invincible: Guarding The Globe Codes

To find more Invincible: Guarding The Globe codes, be sure to visit the game's official social media pages. This is where the developers publish them first, so if you are attentive enough to follow the updates, you can be the first to receive rewards in this free mobile game.

  • Official Invincible: Guarding The Globe Discord server.
  • Official Invincible: Guarding The Globe X account.
  • Official Invincible: Guarding The Globe Facebook page.
  • Official Invincible: Guarding The Globe Instagram account.

Invincible: Guarding The Globe is available on mobile devices.
